data.title: Add sequence & workflow diagram support to Markdown

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: Supporting syntax through [jsSequence](https://bramp.github.io/js-sequence-diagrams/) and [jsFlow](http://flowchart.js.org/) would be great. > related #2273 `````` ```sequence Andrew->China: Says Hello Note right of China: China thinks\nabout it China-->Andrew: How are you? Andrew->>China: I am good thanks! `` `````` `````` ```flow st=>start: Start:>http://www.google.com[blank] e=>end:>http://www.google.com op1=>operation: My Operation sub1=>subroutine: My Subroutine cond=>condition: Yes or No?:>http://www.google.com io=>inputoutput: catch something... st->op1->cond cond(yes)->io->e cond(no)->sub1(right)->op1 `` ``````

data.title: Incorrect syntax highlight of async on arrow functions
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1.  Within a .js or .ts file, add an async lambda function like `async () => {}`
2. Observe that the `async` does not have the expected keyword color, as it would when used before function():

![asyncsyntaxhighlight](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2985923/17270580/33e813ae-5698-11e6-9cbb-0e7a6503ed76.png)

data.title: Autocomplete font size doesn't change with font-size changes
data.body: - VSCode Version: 1.3.1 - OS Version: OS X 10.11.5 Steps to Reproduce: 1. increase font of text, text gets bigger (or smaller) 2. type => autocomplete shows => font of autocomplete text is still small (or big) Of course, i know that the auto complete font becomes bigger when i use the zoom feature, but soon scales everything and that is different.

data.title: Improve Extension version information for updates

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: - VSCode Version: Version 1.4.0-insider (1.4.0-insider) 4656fe3ff2952e9538d81e7a7571674352e5d62f - OS Version: Mac OS X EL Capitan I am currently being offered an Extension update but its not immediately obvious what my current version is and what the latest version I will be updated to is. In the screenshot below, there is version 1.2.2, which I assume is the current version because that panel is showing my currently installed extensions. But if I click on update which version will I get? My suggestion is to add something like "Currently Installed Version: {CurrentVersion}" and "Latest Version: {LatestVersion}" to the panel showing the Extension Information. So for example just above the Update and Uninstall buttons.

data.title: Ignoring tsconfig.json for intellisense with Typescript 2.0
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.1 && 1.4.0-insider
- OS Version: 64 bit Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Install Typescript 2.0: `$ npm install -g typescript@beta`
2. Open Typescript project with Visual Studio Code

Expected:
VS Code uses tsconfig.json to configure its intellisense

Actual:
VS Code ignores tsconfig.json

data.title: Formatting code js and html stop working. Helper runs up CPU
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.4.0-insider (4656fe3ff2952e9538d81e7a7571674352e5d62f, 2016-07-29T05:03:52.605Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 15.5.0

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Install the last update
2. Open a project you've been working on for the last 3 days.

Code formatting (js and html) just stops working.
CPU runs high with Code - Insiders Helper.
This was fine for a about a week, and now it is back. 
[Sample of Code - Insiders Helper3.txt](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/files/391806/Sample.of.Code.-.Insiders.Helper3.txt)

data.title: please remove this issue.
Check if adapter is null and let it print errors
data.body:
I had entire sections in the package.json missing and the errors I was getting were not helpful at all, it just said "e.adapter.variables undefined". Well it's undefined because the adapter is null!
If we work around that null we can get actually helpful messages here.

data.title: Update default project.json TFMs
data.body: When manually creating a new `project.json` file, opening IntelliSense, and selecting **Default project.json**, the default `project.json` file is created with old DNX target framework monikers. Since DNX is dead, this PR updates the default `project.json` to use the same TFMs used by the ASP.NET Core project templates in VS 2015.

data.title: "Toggle Line Comment" doesn't work as expected while multi-line selected
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Select the lines with both commented lines and un-commented lines
2. Execute "Toggle Line Comment"

Original Text:

>  // line 1
>  line 2

Current Result:

>  // // line 1
>  // line 2

Expected Result:

>  line 1
>  // line 2

data.title: How to get access to the application window from an extension
Explorer can freeze for large folders and many glob patterns
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 Pro

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open a folder from visual studio code
2. In the sidebar, select a subfolder with a huge number of files (mine has over 70000 json files)

Then the window will just freeze. No response to click or keyboard whatsoever, until after a while the system reports that "The Window is no longer responding". 

Thank you!

data.title: Closing a file that is open in twice (split panes) with unsaved changes prompts to save
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open a file and make some changes (don't save)
2. Split the window (`Ctrl`+`\`)
3. Close the file to remove the split

You'll be prompted to save changes (and clicking `Don't Save` will undo the changes). This isn't what I would expect, I would've expected the second file to silently close and the in-memory changes remain (since the file is still open and visible with changes in the other pane).

data.title: Integrated Terminal Backlog
data.body:
This is a ranked backlog of the larger, heavy hitter items within the [overall integrated terminal backlog](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3Aintegrated-terminal).
1. ✅ Expose integrated terminal extension API #9957
2. ✅ Add scroll bar to integrated terminal #6602
3. Integrated terminal does not launch when project folder contains special/unicode characters #7727
4. Add virtual selection to integrated terminal #9958

This list does not contain smaller issues, check the milestone the specific issue is associated with for that. The full backlog of integrated terminal issues is available [here](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3Aintegrated-terminal).

data.title: Add virtual selection to integrated terminal
data.body:
This will enable things like:
- Double clicking on the prompt line being flaky due to focus shifting from `.xterm` to the text area.
- Double clicking on a URL/path to highlight the whole path (ie. don't use `/` and similar chars as separators)
- Selecting and copying multiple pages of the buffer

Upstream issue: https://github.com/sourcelair/xterm.js/issues/207

data.title: Expose integrated terminal extension API
data.body:
The initial extension API will allow:
- Creating and optionally naming of a terminal instance
- Sending commands (text sequences + `'\n'`) to these "owned" terminal instances

Additional APIs will be considered via feedback from consumers.

Related: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/547
